intro: Odontoglossum cristatellum subsp. lehmannii, commonly known as the Lehmann’s toothed orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking violet to purple flowers with a distinctive toothed lip. It thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained, humus-rich soil. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
